chinese: “爸爸拿着斧子去哪儿了？”在他们收拾桌子准备吃早饭时，芬问她的母亲。
english: "Where's Papa going with the ax?" said Fern to her mother as they were setting the table for breakfast.

chinese: “去猪圈了，”阿拉贝尔太太回答。“昨晚生了几只小猪。”
english: "Out to the hog house," replied Mrs.Arable. "Some pigs were born last night."

chinese: “我不明白他为什么需要一把斧子，”只有八岁的芬继续说。
english: "I don't see why he needs an ax," continued Fern, who was only eight.

chinese: “哦，”她的母亲说，“其中的一头是个小个子。它长得又小又弱，没有任何可留下来的价值了。所以你爸爸决定去消灭它。”
english: "Well," said her mother, "one of the pigs is a runt. It's very small and weak, and it will never amount to anything. So your father decided to do away with it."

chinese: “消灭它？”芬尖叫。“你是说杀死它？就因为他比别人的个子小？”
english: "Do away with it?" shrieked Fern. "You mean kill it? Just because it's smaller than the others?"

chinese: 阿拉贝尔太太把一罐乳酪放到桌上。
english: Mrs.Arable put a pitcher of cream on the table.

chinese: “别嚷，芬！”她说。“你爸做的对。那头猪不论如何都会死的。”
english: "Don't yell, Fern!" she said. "Your father is right. The pig would probably die any way."

chinese: 芬推开挡在面前的椅子就往门外跑。
english: Fern pushed a chair out of the way and ran outdoors.

chinese: 草地湿漉漉的，泥土里散发着春天的气息。
english: The grass was wet and the earth smelled of springtime.

chinese: 等芬赶上她的爸爸时，她的运动胶鞋全都湿透了。
english: Fern's sneakers were sopping by the time she caught up with her father.

chinese: “请别杀它！”她呜咽道。“这不公平！”
english: "Please don't kill it!" she sobbed. "It's unfair."

chinese: 阿拉贝尔先生止住了脚。
english: Mr.Arable stopped walking.

chinese: “芬，”他温柔的说，“你该学会自我控制。”
english: "Fern," he said gently, "you will have to learn to control yourself."

chinese: “自我控制？”芬哭叫道，“这可是一件生死大事！你却对我说什么自我控制！”
english: "Control myself?" yelled Fern, "That is a matter of life and death, and you talk about controlling myself."

chinese: 泪水流到芬的面颊上，她抓住了斧头柄，想把它从父亲手中抢下来。
english: Tears ran down her cheeks and she took hold of the ax and tried to pull it out if her father's hand.

chinese: “芬，”阿拉贝尔先生说，“养小猪的事我比你知道的多。一个体质差的小猪很难养活的。现在你该放我走了！”
english: "Fern," said Mr.Arable, "I know more about raising a litter of pigs than you do. A weakling makes trouble. Now run along!"

chinese: “可是这不公平，”芬哭叫着。“这头猪愿意让自己生下来就小吗，它愿意吗？如果我生下来时也很瘦小，你就会杀死我吗？”
english: "But it's unfair," cried Fern. "The pig couldn't help being born small, could it? If I had been very small at birth, would you have killed me?"

chinese: 阿拉贝尔先生笑了。“当然不会了，”他说着，低下头慈爱地望着女儿。
english: Mr.Arable smiled. "Certainly not," he said, looking down at his daughter with love.

chinese: “但这是不一样的。一个小女孩是一码事儿，一个小瘦猪是另一码事儿。”
english: "But this is different. A little girl is one thing, a little runty pig is another."

chinese: “我看没什么不一样，”芬回答着，仍死抓着斧柄不放。
english: "I see no difference," replied Fern, still hanging one to the ax.

chinese: “这是我曾经听到过的最恐怖的案件！”
english: "This is the most terrible case of injustice I ever heard of."

chinese: 约翰·阿拉贝尔先生的脸上出现了某种奇特的表情。
english: A queer look came over John Arable's face.

chinese: 他好像也要哭了。
english: He seemed almost ready to cry himself.

chinese: “好吧，”他说。“你先回家吧。等我回家，我会把那头小猪带回来。我将让你用奶瓶喂他，像喂婴儿一样。那时你就会明白一头小猪会多么麻烦了。”
english: "All right," he said. "You go back to the house and I will bring the runt when I come in. I'll let you start it on a bottle, like a baby. Then you'll see what trouble a ping can be."

chinese: 半小时后，阿拉贝尔先生胳膊下夹着一个纸板盒回了家。
english: when Mr.Arable returned to the house half an hour later, he carried a carton under his arm.

chinese: 芬正在楼上换她的运动鞋。
english: Fern was upstairs changing her sneakers.

chinese: 厨房的桌子上摆好了早餐，房间里都是咖啡，薰肉的香味，湿湿的灰泥味儿，还有从炉子里荡出来的柴火烟味儿。
english: The kitchen table was set for breakfast, and room smelled of coffee, bacon, damp plaster, and wood smoke from the stove.

chinese: “把它放到她的椅子上！”阿拉贝尔太太说。
english: "Put it on her chair!" said Mrs.Arable.

chinese: 阿拉贝尔先生把纸板盒放到芬的位子上。
english: Mr.Arable set the carton down at Fern's place.

chinese: 然后他到洗手池洗了手，用池边滚筒上的毛巾把手擦干。
english: Then he walked to the sink and washed his hands and dried them on the roller towel.

chinese: 芬慢慢地下了楼。
english: Fern came slowly down the stairs.

chinese: 因为刚刚哭过，她的眼还是红红的。
english: Her eyes were red from crying.

chinese: 当她走近她的椅子，纸板盒开始晃动起来，里面传出了抓搔声。
english: As she approached her chair, the carton wobbled, and there was a scratching noise...

chinese: 芬看了看她的父亲。
english: Fern looked at her father.

chinese: 然后她掀起了盒盖。
english: Then she lifted the lid of the carton.

chinese: 从那里面打量着她的，正是那新生的小猪。
english: There, inside, looking up at her, was the new born pig.

chinese: 它是白色的。
english: It was a white one.

chinese: 早晨的阳光把它的耳朵映得粉红。
english: The morning light shone through its ears, turning them pink.

chinese: “他是你的了，” 阿拉贝尔先生说，“是你使他免于一死。愿上帝能原谅我这愚蠢的行为。”
english: "He's yours," said Mr.Arable. "Saved from an untimely death. And may the good Lord forgive me for this foolishness."

chinese: 芬目不转睛地看着这头小猪。
english: Fern couldn't take her eyes off the tiny pig.

chinese: “哦，”她轻声赞美，“哦，看他呀！他漂亮极了。” 她小心的关上了盖子。
english: "Oh," she whispered. "Oh, look at him! He's absolutely perfect." She closed the carton carefully.

chinese: 她先吻了爸爸，又吻了妈妈。
english: First she kissed her father she kissed her mother.

chinese: 然后她又揭开盖子，把小猪举起来，让他贴到自己的脸上。
english: Then she opened the lid again, lifted the pig out, and held it against her cheek.

chinese: 这时，她的哥哥埃弗里走了进来。
english: At this moment her brother Avery came into the room.

chinese: 埃弗里十岁了。
english: Avery was ten.

chinese: 他的身上可是全副武装呢——一只手里拿着气枪，一只手里攥着一把木制匕首。
english: He was heavily armed -- an air rifle in one hand, a wooden dagger in the other.

chinese: “那是什么？”他问。“芬得了什么了？”
english: "What's that?" he demanded. "What's Fern got?"

chinese: “她有了一位来吃早餐的客人，” 阿拉贝尔太太说。“埃弗里，去洗手洗脸！”
english: "She's got a guest for breakfast," said Mrs.Arable. "Wash your hands and face, Avery!"

chinese: “让我看看它嘛！”埃弗里说着，放下他的枪。“你说这可怜的小东西是一头猪？这不过是一头猪的小型复制品而已——他还没有一只白老鼠大呢。”
english: "Let's see it!" said Avery, setting his gun down. "You call that miserable thing a pig? That's a fine specimen of a pig -- it's no bigger than a white rat."

chinese: “去洗脸吃饭，埃弗里！”他的妈妈说。“半小时内校车就要来了。”
english: "Wash up and eat your breakfast, Avery!" said his mother. "The school bus will be along in half an hour."

chinese: “我也能有一头小猪吗，爸爸？”埃弗里问。
english: "Can I have a pig, too, Pop?" asked Avery.

chinese: “不，我只把小猪送给早起的人，” 阿拉贝尔先生说，“为了制止这世界上的不公正行为，芬天刚亮就起床了。结果，她现在有了一头小猪。当然了，他的确是特别小，可不管怎么说这都是一头小猪。这只是表明，如果一个人能迅速地从床上爬起来，会有什么样的事情发生。让我们开饭吧！”
english: "No, I only distribute pigs to early risers," said Mr.Arable."Fern was up at daylight, trying to rid world of injustice. As a result, she now has a pig. A small one, to be sure, but never the less a pig. It just shows what can happen if a person gets out of bed promptly. Let's eat!"

chinese: 但是芬要等到她的小猪喝完牛奶后才肯吃饭。
english: But Fern couldn't eat until her pig had a drink of milk.

chinese: 阿拉贝尔太太找出了一个婴儿用的奶瓶和奶嘴儿。
english: Mrs.Arable found a baby's nursing bottle and a rubber nipple.

chinese: 她把温乎乎的牛奶倒进奶瓶里，又把奶嘴儿安上，才把奶瓶递给了芬。
english: She poured warm milk into the bottle, fitted the nipple over the top, and handed it to Fern.

chinese: “给他吃早餐吧！”她说。
english: "Give him his breakfast!" she said.

chinese: 一分钟后，芬坐在厨房角落里的地板上，把她的小宝贝抱在膝头，开始教他如何从瓶中喝奶。
english: A minuter later, Fern was seated on the floor in the corner of the kitchen with her infant between her knees, teaching it to suck from the bottle.

chinese: 这小猪虽然那么小，却有一个好胃口，而且也学得很快。
english: The pig, although tiny, had a good appetite and caught on quickly.

chinese: 路上响起了校车的喇叭声。
english: The school bus honked from the road.

chinese: “快跑！” 阿拉贝尔太太命令着，把小猪从芬那里抱下来，将一张油煎圈饼放到她的手上。
english: "Run!" commanded Mrs.Arable, taking the pig from Fern and slipping a doughnut into her hand.

chinese: 埃弗里赶忙抓起他的枪和另一张油煎圈饼。
english: Avery grabbed his gun and another doughnut.

chinese: 孩子们跑到路边，上了校车。
english: The children ran out to the road and climbed into the bus.

chinese: 在车里，芬没有注意其他的人。
english: Fern took no notice of the others in the bus.

chinese: 她只是坐在那里朝车窗外看，想着这是个多美好的世界，自己又是多么幸运，居然可以拥有一头小猪。
english: She just sat and stared out of the window, thinking what a blissful world it was and how lucky she was to have entire charge of a pig.

chinese: 在车开到学校的那一刻，芬已经给她的宝贝起好了名字，选的是她能想到的最漂亮的名字。
english: By the time the bus reached school, Fern had named her pet, selecting the most beautiful names she could think of.

chinese: “它的名字是威伯。”她喃喃的自语。
english: "Its name is Wilbur," she whispered to herself.

chinese: 当老师在课堂里问她：“芬，宾夕法尼亚洲的首府叫什么？”时，她还在想着那头小猪。
english: She was still thinking about the pig when the teacher said: "Fern, what is the capital of Pennsylvania?"

chinese: “威伯。”芬出神的回答。
english: "Wilbur," replied Fern, dreamily.

chinese: 同学们格格地笑起来。
english: The pupils giggled.

chinese: 芬脸红了。
english: Fern blushed.
